name: Killbot (itch)
description:
Welcome to KILLBOT! Anyone who may be interested should follow this project or me for future updates. Also the music is temporary for now until I figure out how to make it better.

   Killbot is a sort of arcadey styled wave based platformer. The goal is pretty simple prove your superiority to other similar looking robots, and defeat all the bosses.

The game is simple but pretty decent for killing time. It starts off fairly easy actually, and grows in difficulty as you progress.

As the current copy of the game is basically a demo it is almost complete and it is missing a few things the final version will have.

Controls

  • W   - Switch Ammo Type
  • S     - Switch Ammo Type
  • A        - Move Left
  • D       - Move Right
  • Space - Jump
  • E - Fire
  • Escape - Typically return.

The final version is planned to have:

  • A few more enemy types ( an engineer that places mines, and thumper bots that generate shockwaves when falling down )
  • Pickups dropped from enemies ( to keep you up when your low on ammo )
  • Explosives ( the implementation is present but animations need to be made ) Done.
  • Potentially more levels (Don't count on this one)
  • Melee attacks for the player.
  • A few more bosses.

As well as some missing things like a pause menu.

As of right now a demo / preview of the game is avaliable. A final release will be done likely a bit after.

   A "Hello World!" Message

          Now a personal message, so hello! I am Xpost2000, I play Dark Souls and other types of RPGs and video games. I also wanted to learn game development. So for the last two years or so I've learned how to program video games. Up until this I've never produced anything I considered worthy enough. That's basically my whole message. Now despite this I want you to give me good criticism despite this. I will be honest though as it is my first time I don't know how to react, but I will attempt to be as professional as I can be with it.

Thank you for visiting this project page, thank you for reading, and thank you if you decided to play this game :)

Also since this is a prerelease version I would like to emphasize please report any bugs you find! It would be very appreciated!
